articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Augmented in G# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Augmented in G# (Shape: D)

## Description
An arpeggio is the playing of the notes of a chord in a broken fashion, usually ascending or descending. In this case, the arpeggio is played in the augmented chord quality and is in the key of G# with the shape of a D chord.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (1)
- C (Augmented 4)
- E# (Augmented 7)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
An augmented arpeggio like this one can create a dissonant and mystical sound due to the augmented 4th interval. It can add tension and an exotic flavor to the music it is used in. Augmented arpeggios are commonly found in genres like jazz, fusion, and some progressive rock where musicians are looking to introduce a sense of unpredictability and outside harmonic colors.

## Songs
Here are three songs that make use of the Augmented arpeggio in the key of G# with the D shape:
1. "Eugene's Trick Bag" by Steve Vai
2. "Bo Carrows Guitar" by Coheed and Cambria
3. "Augmented Fourth" by Between the Buried and Me
